Authors:
Tuula M. Niskanen, Kare Liimatainen, Joseph F. Ammirati,
Ilkka Kytövuori
Title:
New Cortinarius species from conifer dominated forests of
North America and Europe
Keywords:
Agaricales, ITS, molecular systematics, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Five new medium-sized to large Cortinarius species are
described based on morphological and molecular data. Three of them, C.
aavae, C. brunneocalcarius, and C. grosmorneÃ«nsis, belong to subgenus
Telamonia and one, C. subfloccopus, to /Fulvescentes. The relationship
of the fifth species, C. brunneotinctus, was not solved but it resembles
species of /Anomali. Cortinarius brunneocalcarius and C. aavae do not
have close relatives within the subgenus Telamonia whereas C.
grosmorneÃ«nsis belongs to sect. Brunnei. Four of the species have wide
distribution, Cortinarius brunneocalcarius and C. subfloccopus occur in
North America and Europe and C. brunneotinctus and C. aavae in Western
and Eastern North America, but C. grosmorneÃ«nsis is only known from
Eastern Canada. The descriptions of the novel species are presented and
comparison to similar species provided.
